metadataAttributes.Title: Speaking to inform:  Discussing complex ideas with clear explanations and dynamic slides
metadataAttributes.Short Intro: In the professional realm, most speeches and presentations we give are informative in scope. A scientist needs to explain her recent research findings. A financial officer needs to report on quarterly earnings to his company’s board. A technology professional needs to educate a consumer about a new product. Any time you need to convey ideas or demonstrate a process, you’re dealing with informative speaking.
